item.title: About the DIV project
item.description: Every year, vulnerable road users (VRU: cyclists and pedestrians) account for about 28% of all road fatalities in Europe. Because of their intrinsic vulnerability, cyclists and pedestrians are especially at risk of severe injuries and death in conflicts with motorized vehicles Interaction between VRU and motorized vehicles is particularly critical in crossing scenarios (Dozza and Werneke 2014) where the trajectory of a motorist and a VRU intersect, as well as in longitudinal scenarios when a motorist may overtake a slower VRU (DaCoTa-Project 2011).

item.title: Add texture
item.description: Create a plane (Shift + A) Add a material by pressing new in the material tab. Add a texture by pressing new in the texture tab. Open the picture you want as texture. Change the view to UV-editing. Choose your picture in the list. Press TAB to go into edit mode and choose Unwrap (U) to paste the picture onto the plane. Make sure you are in Texture display mode

item.title: How to create animated bicyclist model for OpenDS
item.description: Prepare the models Import bike model Bicycle N011211.3ds model using importer 3D Studio in Blender. Create a Human model using MakeHuman modeling tool. Export to .mhx format Import human model.mhx to blender Under default mode Combine both bike and rider model together by placing the rider on the seat of the bike. Create a two Armature bone structure corresponding two pedals to be able to move the pedals, which can be coupled so that human rider model can be moved.

item.title: How to animate human models
item.description: Blender’s version used for this tutorial is v2.6b. And the tutorial video used as a reference: link Prepare the human model Import the make human model as described in the makeHuman model document (here) The model with be visible. Click the right extension tab to open additional kinematic option. Scroll down and change leg FK to IK both left and right. This is done to constrain the model to ground plane and easily manipulated to make the animation.

item.title: Importing human model to Blender
item.description: 1.Open Blender application, to import the make human model 2.File>user preference> files> Check auto run python script. 3.To add Makehuman importer 4.File>user preference> add ons> import-export> check make human importer 5.To Import the .mhx file go to files>import>make human(.mhx) 6.You can see the imported model on your workspace

item.title: How to create a human model
item.description: Open Makehuman application Adjust the Macros to the required human model in the tab Modelling. Where, Gender, Age, Muscle, Weight, Height, Proportions, Skin shade, Ethnicity can be manipulated in the form of percentage. The result of the changes can be seen in the human model instantly. The values of the model created i.e gender, age, weight etc can be seen in the bottom left part of make human.
